column5: What shore spots on lake simcoe  produces good fish, primarily bass, walleye or pike? I know right now the season is closed but when it opens up it would be good to have some new spots to try
The only place I get walleye From shore on simcoe is near Beaverton and as for the others the good spots I have are good because not too many people know them. So sorry but I can not share
Don't believe Terry, he's actually not sorry. HH
They must be really secret Joe. Even I don't know them,or maybe I do and have not caught anything at them .

Your question is pretty loaded friend . Asking for spots on ANY open forum is pretty much taboo.  As for shore spot on Simcoe, you will be pressed to find any that you will need to be a resident of the area . It is getting worse by the year . Good luck to you and your search.
Was lodged at " The Biars "  at Jackson's Point for a couple of months on a summer job, caught some bass and pike around the mouth of Black River shore casting, would have been the summer of '71.
Dave if you released those fish they will be HUGE by now. Great tip!
funny how this guy hasnt posted again or seemingly even been back? My suggestion is if you are going to fish simcoe from shore, make sure you cast towards the water.
i was thinkin an inner tube and just follow Brian around. HH
Brian will launch a musky lure with #5/0 trebles and there goes your inner tube.
My follower club is full at the moment Joe , but can put on a waiting list .
